title: Geographical Location
description: Located on the eastern bank of the Nile River, approximately 10 kilometers north of the city of Samalut, the mountain offers breathtaking views of the Nile, making it a unique destination for visitors.

tips.one: It is believed that the Holy Family (the Virgin Mary, the Child Jesus, and Saint Joseph the Carpenter) visited this site during their sacred journey to Egypt.

tips.two: The mountain is also known as 'Gebel El-Kaf' (Mountain of the Palm) due to a legend that says the handprint of the Virgin Mary was imprinted on a rock while she was protecting her child from falling.

title: Tourism Development
description: The Egyptian government is working on developing the area into a global tourist destination by improving roads and services around the site.

title: The Monastery of the Virgin Mary at Gebel El-Tair

tips.one: The church dates back to the 4th century AD and was built by Queen Helena, the mother of Emperor Constantine.

tips.two: The church is built into the mountain, giving it the appearance of being carved out of the rock.

tips.three: It is one of the most prominent landmarks of the mountain and contains ancient icons and altars.

tips.one: Gebel El-Tair is considered a pilgrimage site for Egyptian Copts, especially during the Feast of the Virgin Mary, celebrated in May each year.

tips.two: Pilgrims visit the site for blessings and prayers, as it is regarded as a sacred place that was blessed by the visit of the Holy Family.

tips.one: In addition to its religious value, the mountain is renowned for its stunning natural scenery and its panoramic view of the Nile.

tips.two: The site includes archaeological areas and inscribed rocks that date back to ancient times.
